author: Ralph Steer
comment: Gives heart rate on the watch without the phone direct from mio band which is excellent. Cant understand watch display. Instruction would be nice. Youtube help video has fault and will not play on anything. Hence only 4 stars. Still v good to see pulse on watch. Deadly accurate as well.
title: Works well with smart watch 3

author: Simon McGrath
comment: Best app I've found to work with my Mio Alpha heart rate monitor. It connects easily, holds the connection - and is the only app I found that doesn't need wifi turned off to hold a bluetooth connection to the heart rate monitor.   Nice graphical displays too for the current workout. Pity you can't save and view workouts (only export raw data) but it's so much better than everything else I tried (including Mio Go) that I still think it's worth 5*.

reply.author: Athlete Grip
reply.content:
App version 1.0.20 is released with
- save and load workouts 
- fixes

title: Terrific - and works with Mio Alpha

author: Terry Hargraves
comment: Took me over two hours to figure out it doesn't work with either my Runtastic Bluetooth OR my Polar Bluetooth heart rate straps AND it doesn't work with either my Pebble Time OR my Gear2 watch. Too late for a refund. It's not that $2.65 is going to break my budget, but I feel abused and taken advantage of. I checked for a free version before I purchased but didn't see one. So I bought it. When I went back to check for a refund, the refund button was gone, but NOW the free version shows up as an option. Pfffgt.

reply.author: Athlete Grip
reply.content:
"Bluetooth 4.x LE
Tested with:
- Sony Smartwatch 3 + Polar H7 + GPS
- Motorola Moto 360 + Polar H7 
…"
Pebble Time OR Gear2 (Samsung OS)!
Tested devices all Android Wearable!
Use the Support before buy an app!
